title: [Pruning] Check a possibility to add a progress (rough estimation) of how much nodes are yet to be recreated during FullPruning
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
As for now users are very concerned how long pruning may take. There is no info at all - only info is:
```
Full Pruning In Progress: 00:00:57.0603307 1.00 mln nodes mirrored.
Full Pruning In Progress: 00:01:40.3677103 2.00 mln nodes mirrored.
Full Pruning In Progress: 00:02:25.6437030 3.00 mln nodes mirrored.
```
and at the end:
`Full Pruning Finished: 15:25:59.1620756 1,560.29 mln nodes mirrored.`
but lately on one of the users logs I saw that this number keeps increasing:
`Full Pruning Finished: 07:35:54.9600798 1,680.70 mln nodes mirrored.`

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be nice to somehow "fetch" initial guess from the system how much nodes it may need to mirror to complete pruning and refresh it once every 1 hour to adjust it. This would at least give moreless idea where are we at right now and how much it is yet to be done.
